User

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • User.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player class contains information about the playerâ€™s status in the game. Each player will have player_id and token_id. Each player will be assigned a turn order in the beginning of the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      default empty constructor needed for JSP/Servlets and Database Classes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getPlayerID()
      Get the Player id number
      int getSpaceID()
      Returns the value of the Space ID
      boolean getSpectator()
      Called by the game to see if a player is still able to play due to bankruptcy or whatever player is still in the game but only an observer.
      int getTokenID()
      Gets the id of the token image (game pice) assigned to the Player.
      int getUserID()
      Get the database id for the registered User who is the Player.
      void initializePlayer(int userID, int tokenID, int spaceID)
      initializer without a player id
      void initializePlayer(int playerID, int userID, int tokenID, int spaceID)
      initializer needed by the Database Class
      void setPlayerID(int id)
      Set the Player id number.
      void setSpaceID(int spaceID)
      Sets the value of the Space ID
      void setSpectator(boolean spectator)
      Sets the value that determines if a Player is still actively participating in the game (false) or only an observer of the game (true).
      void setTokenID(int id)
      Sets the id of the token image (game pice) assigned to the Player This is the key for the token image file in the database.
      void setUserID(int userID)
      Set the database id for the registered User who is the Player.

      • getSpectator

        public boolean getSpectator()
        Called by the game to see if a player is still able to play due to bankruptcy or whatever player is still in the game but only an observer.
        Returns:
        boolean true if player is no longer taking turns in the game, otherwise false

      • setSpectator

        public void setSpectator(boolean spectator)
        Sets the value that determines if a Player is still actively participating in the game (false) or only an observer of the game (true).
        Parameters:
        spectator - true if player is no longer taking turns in the game, otherwise false

      • getSpaceID

        public int getSpaceID()
        Returns the value of the Space ID
        Returns:
        int the id for the location of the Player on the game board

      • setSpaceID

        public void setSpaceID(int spaceID)
        Sets the value of the Space ID
        Parameters:
        spaceID - the id for the location of the Player on the game board

      • setTokenID

        public void setTokenID(int id)
        Sets the id of the token image (game pice) assigned to the Player This is the key for the token image file in the database.
        Parameters:
        id - the id for the token

      • getTokenID

        public int getTokenID()
        Gets the id of the token image (game pice) assigned to the Player. This is the key for the token image file in the database.
        Returns:
        int the token id

      • setPlayerID

        public void setPlayerID(int id)
        Set the Player id number. This should only be set by the Database Controller when it creates a new Player.
        Parameters:
        id - the Player id in the database and in the game

      • getPlayerID

        public int getPlayerID()
        Get the Player id number
        Returns:
        int the Player id in the database and in the game

      • getUserID

        public int getUserID()
        Get the database id for the registered User who is the Player.
        Returns:
        int the User id

      • setUserID

        public void setUserID(int userID)
        Set the database id for the registered User who is the Player. This should only be set by the Database Controller when it creates a new Player.
        Parameters:
        userID - the User id
